message.content:
cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.RO 

This paper deals with the development of a reinforcement learning-based method for training a robot to generate appropriate verbal and non-verbal backchannels during human-robot interaction. The paper focuses on the engagement level of the user, which is a key aspect of human-robot interaction. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Additionally, the paper involves natural language processing techniques, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses value-based techniques and recurrent layers, which are common in machine learning and deep learning, respectively. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.RO (Robotics) are also likely sub-categories for this paper.
